fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When moving issues from one column to another, by selecting the issue key, if the destination status has a screen associated with it, both the issue view dialog and the transition screen are popped up.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a screen to a transition in your project;
 # Transition an issue selecting the issue key to the status with the screen.

Video reproducing the behavior:  [^Screen Recording 2020-05-07 at 03.18 PM.mov] 

h3. Expected Results

Only the screen associated with the transition will be displayed.

h3. Actual Results

Both issue view modal and screen associated with the transition are displayed.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Workflow screens being displayed over View Issue dialog

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When watchers are updated on the issue, what is shown on the Jira Software card board (both Kanban and Scrum) doesn't reflect this change.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access the active sprint;
 # Open any issue;
 # Add or exclude a watcher;
 # The number of watchers will stay the same, not reflecting the change. Not even refreshing the page updated this information.

h3. Expected Results

The number of watchers should be automatically updated on the card, reflecting what is the issue view is showing.
h3. Actual Results

!image-2020-05-07-15-22-45-297.png|width=584,height=137!

[https://share.getcloudapp.com/DOuQrXKY]

This seems to only happen with Watchers field. I've tried to reproduce the same problem with other fields (as Assignee, Updated) and the problem did not happen.
h3. Workaround

If you move the issue to another column, the number of watchers is then correctly updated.
fields.summary: When Watchers field is updated on the issue, the card on Jira board is not also updated

fields.description:
Would it be possible to add the status field from issues to te new navigationbar at the top?
This would enable us to quickly scroll down an issue, comment and shortly thereafter just send the issue to the next status with the field on top, instead of needing to scroll back up manually.
fields.summary: Add Status field to new Navigationbar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Permission error when accessing issue from Bitbucket using *Safari*.

 # User should have the necessary permissions to view the issue in Jira.
# Access an issue in Bitbucket from *Safari*. 
 # It will through error “You don't have access to this issue. Make sure the issue exists in this project. If it does, ask a project admin for permission to see the project's issues.” 
However the issue can be accessed from Jira without any permission error. 

h3. Expected Results
Issue should be viewable from Bitbucket in *Safari*.

h3. Actual Results
Permission error. 

h3. Workaround
Issue can be viewed from Bitbucket when access in *Safari Private mode* or using different browser.
fields.summary: Permission error when accessing issue from Bitbucket using Safari.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a the furthest right column is deleted in Next-gen projects, the issues are automatically moved to the closest column. This would indicate a transition from one status to another, however, this transition is not logged in the Issue History. In fact, nothing is logged.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Next-gen board
 # Add a new column to the furthest right side
 # Add issues to the furthest right column
 # Delete the column

h3. Expected Results
Issues would be moved to the closest status under the same category and their respective issue histories should log the transition.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing is logged in the issues' history.

h3. Workaround
Before deleting the column, bulk transition the issues to a column that won't be deleted.
fields.summary: Deleting the furthest right column in Next-gen projects will not log an entry in the issues’ history

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When transitioning an issue to any status on new issue view, the development panel will disappear from the field list on the right. The development panel will reappear back after refreshing the issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a DVCS integration set up
 # Ensure that the Development panel is appearing on the right among the other fields.
 # Transition the issue to any status, the development panel will go missing

h3. Expected Results
* The Development panel should remain visible after transitioning the issue.

h3. Actual Results
* The Development panel is missing after transitioning the issue.

h3. Workaround
* Refresh the issue.
fields.summary: Transitioning issue on new issue view will cause development panel to go missing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the new issue view, when users have an Active Sprint running, they will see a duplicated value for it when using the new issue view. This causes misleading information like a possible database inconsistency or which value they should select. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable the new issue view
# Start a Sprint
# Open the select list from Sprint field

New issue view:
 !new view.png|thumbnail! 
Old issue view:
 !old view.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Only one sprint value will appears as there is no duplicate entry in the database.

h3. Actual Results
Users see duplicate values

h3. Workaround
Deactivate the new issue view.
fields.summary: On new issue view, Sprint field shows duplicate sprints value

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Changing the status of an issue after removing it from the sprint can cause changes to 'story points completed' to be applied twice, making burnup/burndown reports out of sync with the sprint.

NOTE: There is a related issue which we have not been able to replicate that we believe is linked to this bug, described here: [https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/PCS-6025]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Complete an item(issue 1) in the active sprint
 # move issue 1 from the sprint to the backlog
 # transition issue 1 from done → ready
 # open burnup report

h3. Expected Results

In the sprint reports:

- Completed story points should increase by the amount of story points on the issue when the issue is completed.

- Completed story points should decrease by the same amount when the issue is removed from the sprint.
h3. Actual Results

In the sprint reports:

- Completed story points increases when the issue is completed

- Completed story points  decreases when the issue is removed from the sprint

- Completed story points decreases *again* when the issue is reopened in the backlog
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Changing the status of issues after removing from the sprint causes sprint reports to become inaccurate

fields.description:

Let say, in the attached screenshot, once I import this Trello card in Jira, "write an intro blog" , "update laptop" will become subtasks in Jira but there will be no traces of the parent checklist i.e. "my pending work"
fields.summary: Please represent the parent checklist name as well on the sub-tasks which got imported from Trello to Jira

fields.description:
{quote}As a Jira-board-using team member

I want the ability to order the issues on my board with a board sort order on the filter

So that I can see the most important delivery work without impacting the product owner's backlog rank order
{quote}
 

Acceptance criteria:
 * Projects have a backlog, and zero-to-many boards (with reports): the backlog and boards should have their own sort order for issues
 * The backlog sort order will be set using the new Backlog Settings feature
 * The board sort order will be set using the Board Settings.  This order will also change the order of data supplied to the board's reports.
 * For Scrum boards, the open and active sprint will be the basis of the board filter, and the order by expression sets the issue order on the board
 * For Kanban boards, there is no longer a need for a board sub-filter as the backlog has its own filter now
 * When swim lanes are used for a board, the board sort order is the final ordering clause after any ordering determined by the swimlane selection
 * The default backlog sort order is Rank ASC
 * The default board sort order is Rank ASC

 

Business case:

Ideally, teams should work on the highest priority issues and limit their work in progress to one item at a time (single piece flow). In the real world: expedite situations occur, teams have knowledge silos, and delivery decision-making is different from backlog refinement decision-making.  Having independent sort order criteria for backlogs and boards helps teams meet many of these needs, and frees the product owner/champion to organize and select work based upon their own decisions.
fields.summary: Add ability to sort items on a board independent of the backlog order

fields.description:

!Image 2020-04-28 at 5.29.11 PM.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*
Currently, we cannot set a Story's Fix Version field from the Epic Link it was created.

h3. *Suggested Solution*
It would be great if JIRA can provide a feature to set Fix Version automatically for each issue created under an Epic

h3. *Why this is important*
Currently, we will need to manually set fix version for each of the issues created by epic one by one which is time-consuming. Hence having a feature to automatically set the fix version of each created issue under and epic automatically will reduce lots of overhead work when using JIRA.
 
h3. *Workaround* 
Can use  Bulk Update the fixVersions of the issues linked to a certain Epic from time to time. It's still a manual action but it limits it to one action per Epic instead of changing the fixVersion of every single issue by hand.
fields.summary: Set Issue Fix Version from Epic Link

fields.description:
{quote}As a Jira administrator

I want to set a sort order attribute for Status

So that teams can better manage their work items
{quote}
 

Acceptance criteria
 * Status has an attribute of _status sort order_ (similar to status category) which determines the display and reporting order of status values
 * _Status sort order_ impacts the drop-down lists of status values, such as on Issue View and in-line editing
 * _Status sort order_ impacts reporting/filtering, allowing selection of the value as ASC or DESC, for better control of the output
 * _Status sort order_ can be selected on dashboard gadgets as a sort value
 * _Status sort order_ can be set using drag-n-drop on a list of the possible status values within the scope of the view: board, project, or instance
 * Optional: _Status sort order_ attribute can also be set numerically: 1, 2, 3, etc.  When used, no two statuses can have the same Status sort order value.
 * Status values can be created at a board and project level, so _status sort order_ should configurable at that scope as well
 * _Status sort order_ at a project level *can be shadowed* by values set at higher scopes, such as instance.  This supports multi-project board and reporting functions.

 

Business justification:

Having the ability to sort items by status order enables easier configuration and better reporting. When editing an issue, people tend to think in the order of their team's workflow.  The current design appears to show status values in alphanumeric order, which may be very different from workflow order.  When reporting on items with filters, ordering by status order would lead to a list much easier to understand and take action upon.
fields.summary: Add sort order attribute for Status

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After added the time tracking field in the issue type story (used as a test) on the next-gen project, when I create a story, it does not show the option to configure the field. The filed is showing when I open the issue created but is not showing when I'm creating an issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a next-gen project.
 # Go to *project settings >> issue type*.
 # Add the *Time tracking* field to the issue type that you want.
 # *Save* it.
 # Create an issue using the issue type that you configured the *time tracking* field.

h3. Expected Results

When you are creating an issue, the time tracking field is showing as an option to configure.
h3. Actual Results

When you are creating an issue, the time tracking field is *not* showing as an option to configure. However, the field is showing when I view the issue created.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Time tracking field is not showing when creating an issue in next-gen projects

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of June 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all,

We have recently introduced the epic panel in next gen projects! With this capability, you can order your epics by dragging and dropping epics around in the panel. The same order will be reflected in your roadmap and board.

To learn more and/or provide feedback about the epic panel, read [our community post here.|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Next-gen-articles/Improved-Backlog-planning-in-next-gen-with-the-epic-panel/ba-p/1387675]

Thank you, 
Emily Chan
Product Manager, Atlassian.
{panel}

When grouping by Epics on the next-gen board, there is no way to reorder the Epics.  This makes it impossible for the dev teams to know which is the 'next Epic off the rank' when picking up new work.

If you could sort the Epics on the board, that would solve the problem.

Ideally, there would be some link between the Roadmap and the Jira board.  However, there are cases where roadmaps overlap, making the Epic sequencing unclear.  Hence, the primary ask here is to allow the Epics to be at least manually movable on the Jira board.
fields.summary: Next-gen Board allow ordering of epics

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Creating multiple workflows under one project doesn't de-classify it as "Simplified"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * create a new project with a simplified workflow
 * associate multiple workflows for the different issue types 

h3. Expected Results

Workflows under this project would be declassified as simplified. Updates to these workflows would now be managed under Jira administration > Workflows only and not on the project itself
h3. Actual Results

Workflows under this project are still considered simplified. "Add Status" button is still visible on the boards and thus allowing project administrators to manage the workflows within the project.
h3. Workaround

Workaround 1: Create a new Jira Workflow scheme. Switching to the newly created workflow scheme will make the Add Status button disappear. Simplify Workflow button will NOT appear.

Workaround 2: Create a new Jira project. Switching to the newly created projects workflow scheme will make the Add Status button disappear. Simplify Workflow button will appear.
The workflows can be controlled in the newly created schemes.
fields.summary: Creating multiple workflows under one project doesn't de-classify it as "Simplified"

fields.description:

I think it would be great to be able to specify an input for the Quick Filter query (e.g. User(s), Priority, etc); Then we wouldn't need a whole bunch of separate filters.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding a custom Field To a Card as covered in [Customizing cards |https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/customizing-cards-938845307.html], valid Custom Field options can be excluded if using an Issue Type in the filter
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Custom Field with *applicable issue types* set to any restricted value (EXE set this to Story only)
 # Create a board with a Filter that has an OR statement including *issuetype = <any other issue type>* EXE:
{code:java}
project = <Insert Project> AND (component = <Insert Component> OR issuetype = <Insert Any Issuetype other than Story>) ORDER BY Rank ASC
{code}

 # Navigate to the Boards *Card Layout* and attempt to add in your custom Field

h3. Expected Results

Custom Field is available
h3. Actual Results

Custom Field is missing from potions. The Custom Field should be available as it applies to some but not all of the issues present in the filter results.
h3. Workaround
 * Temporarily set the *applicable issue types* under the Custom fields *scheme context* to *Any Issue Type* see [Specifying field behavior: Modifying field behavior |https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/specifying-field-behavior-938847255.html#Specifyingfieldbehavior-changingfieldsModifyingfieldbehavior]
 * [Apply desired card layout |https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/customizing-cards-938845307.html]
 * Reset *applicable issue types* on field configurations back to the desired settings

Once you have the Field added to the card layout you can remove it from the field context to return the setting to the original state and the field will remain on the card without issue.
fields.summary: Card Layout excludes valid custom fields when board filter contains Issue type

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the active sprint board, when issues are listed per user (by selecting the user profile), the user is not able to open unassigned parent issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Board settings > Swimlanes > Set *Base Swimlanes on* to *Stories*
# Create a Story and create a subtask in the story issue
# Assign the subtask to yourself/a user
# Navigate to the board, select/click on your profile icon so that issues assigned to you will be listed.
# Try to open the parent story by clicking on the issue key


h3. Expected Results
Users should be able to open unassigned parent issues in board view

h3. Actual Results
Users are not able to open unassigned parent issues

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Users are not able to open unassigned parent issues in board view

h3. Issue Summary
When drag and drop a ticket to another status with multiple transitions, the ticket is locked at fixed position and would not allow us to move up or down to choose the right transition. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a board and choose *Based Swimlane on* to Story.
 # Create at least 3 transitions to the next staus

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Next-gen board - "Group by Subtasks" does not respect the rule to do not show completed issues with more than 14 days, it shows issues completed with more than 14 days, we don't see the same behavior when we use the other group by options.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira Software Next-Gen project.
 # Open the board tab.
 # Create tasks and sub-tasks on this board.
 # Leave the sub-task closed for more than 14 days.
 # Change the group by to Subtasks.
 # The completed Subtask will be displayed on your board.
 # Change the group by to None.
 # All completed issues with more than 14 days won't show up on this board.

h3. Expected Results
All completed issues with more than 14 days without updates should be removed from the board view.

h3. Actual Results
When we use the Group by Subtasks filter, completed Subtasks with more than 14 days without updates will keep showing up on the board.

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Next-gen board - Group by Subtasks does not respect the rule to do not show completed issues with more than 14 days.

fields.description:
{quote}As a Jira administrator

I want centralized logging of all changes performed by an administrator

So that I can self-service diagnose errors, repeat actions that worked, and provide education to new administrators
{quote}
AC:
 * All actions within Jira by an administrator are logged
 * Logged actions are centralized and viewable by scope.  For example, a system admin can view a complete log of changes by admins for the entire instance, from top level to project and board level.  A project admin can only see their scope of changes for their project.
 * Major system actions by Atlassian are added to system logs, showing Atlassian as the role.  These would include, and not be limited to: release notifications, sunset of in-use features, changes to licensing limits for instance, changes by in-use marketplace vendor functions, and warnings for approaching limits for license (e.g. automation, storage, active users)
 * Logged actions are searchable and filterable by: changing person, role, date/time, scope, project, and type (e.g. change role, add project, create workflow, delete board, etc.)
 * Action logged can be exported/reported in order to create reference and training information for customer admins
 * Action logs can be displayed within Confluence pages
 * Action logging is immutable, and cannot be edited, with the exception of document retention policies (noted below)
 * And relevant document retention/expiry windows for logs are clearly communicated by Atlassian to admins

 

Business case: 

Jira administration, from an end-user perspective, is a black-box.  There is very limited visibility to what has happened or when changes were made.  This puts an unnecessary burden upon customers, preventing them from self-service correction and improvement, and an unnecessary burden upon Atlassian support to field requests.
fields.summary: add logging of administrator actions

fields.description:
Currently, if a user mistypes the estimation of an issue, there is no option to remove the entry from the history of the issue what makes the reports show a spike in the estimation.

As a product owner, I want to be able to fix estimates which break Burndown and other reports to make it appear properly.
fields.summary: As a product owner, I want to be able to fix estimates which break Burndown and other reports

fields.description:
Change hierarchy of issue types to allow for more than just epics, stories, and sub-tasks.  Include a layer between epic and story for feature.

If epic is a several months long project, then there can be multiple features within that, and then teams can write stories to build those features.

The feature should include feature link just like epic link.

Story would be linked to a feature.  The feature would be linked to the epic.  

This is useful for groups that want to scale Agile using Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) or others frameworks.
fields.summary: Add issue type between Epic and Story

fields.description:
According to the below documentation, in Jira Software Cloud Oauth 2 is only supported when calling the [builds API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/#api-group-Builds], [deployments API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/#api-group-Deployments] and [development information API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/#api-group-Development-Information]:
 - [Integrating Jira Software Cloud with on-premises tools|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/integrate-jsw-cloud-with-onpremises-tools/]

 

However, those APIs are only a subset of the ones available for JSW Cloud (below) and it would be nice to have all of them supported:
{quote}[Backlog|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/#api-group-Backlog]
[Board|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/#api-group-Board]
[Epic|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/#api-group-Epic]
[Issue|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/#api-group-Issue]
[Sprint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/#api-group-Sprint]
[Development Information|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/#api-group-Development-Information]
[Feature Flags|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/#api-group-Feature-Flags]
[Deployments|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/#api-group-Deployments]
[Builds|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/#api-group-Builds]
[Other operations|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/#api-group-Other-operations]{quote}
fields.summary: OAuth 2.0 for all the JSW REST API endpoints

fields.description:
When hovering the mouse over the PR link inside the dev panel in Jira, users can no longer see the repo name, but instead, they're seeing the repo ID.

This causes usability issues, and in case an issue in Jira has multiple PRs linked to it, there isn't a quick way to identify to which repos that PR is from.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, when importing issues via a .CSV file, in case there is a required field that is empty, for example, JIRA will only throw up a generic error, leading the user to raise a ticket with the Atlassian Support. 

h3. Suggestion
For known issue errors that are not that complicated to fix, JIRA could define it up in the UI, in order to reduce the time the end-user will have by raising a ticket and getting support.
fields.summary: Received errors when importing JIRA issues could be clearer

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* There is a field called "{{aggregatetimespent}}" in Jira
* The native time tracking features use this field
* At the time of writing(14-Apr-2020), in next-gen projects, this field sums up the time spent data on child issues(Stories)
* This does not happen in Classic projects

h3. Suggested Solution
* Change the behavior in Classic projects so that time spent is summed up to the parent Epic and other hierarchy within Plans/Advanced roadmaps.

h3. Why this is important
* Currently working for next-gen projects
* Allows summed up time spent data to be used by customers + Jira automation features or third-party apps
 
h3. Workaround 
* No known workarounds
fields.summary: Σ Time Spent-aggregatetimespent on Epics does not sum up child issue time spent values on Classic projects

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the UI language to Japanese at https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences
 # Access a backlog
 # Select End Date from the date picker
 # Click "Start(開始)"

h3. Expected Results

The sprint will start
h3. Actual Results

An error is showing saying an invalid format is entered.
 Checking the network console, POST rest/greenhopper/1.0/sprint/<N>/start is returning 400 error
 !スクリーンショット 2019-03-04 16.03.30.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
This issue occurs only when Date/Time format on Look and Feel settings are not matched with the one on System Advanced Settings (jira.date.time.picker.java.format/jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format).

For that reason, as a workaround, reverting the Date/Time format on Look and Feel settings to its default value by clicking [Revert] button will resolve the issue.

If for some reason you are unable to apply the above changes, please use the following workarounds.
 * Change the UI to English at [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences], or
 * After selecting the date, change the "AM" to "午前" or "PM" to "午後" manually
fields.summary: Unable to start sprint in Japanese UI

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Apply a custom field of date time picker type to a project's create issue screen
# Set the UI language to Japanese
# Click the + button in the sidebar to create a issue
# Enter the summary, pick a date from the custom field and click "Create"

h3. Expected Results
Process will proceed as expected(in this case, an issue will be created)

h3. Actual Results
An error is showing saying an invalid format is entered.

{quote}
無効な日付の形式です。日付は 'dd/MMM/yy h:mm a' の形式で入力してください。
{quote}

Checking the network console, POST /secure/QuickCreateIssue.jspa?decorator=none is returning 400 error:

 !スクリーンショット 2019-03-04 15.45.26.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
* change the UI to English at https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences
* proceed without entering the data and fill it in after the issue is created
* use Date picker instead of Date Time picker
* replace "AM" "PM" with "午前" "午後" respectively

fields.description:
*SCOPE OF THE FEATURE*
* Time reminder is the feature where an issue creator can set a time to remind the assignee of the issue to complete the task before the deadline. If time reminder was not set by ticket creator then the ticket assignee can add reminder time to get notified before the end date of the task.
* By this feature issue assignee will almost never miss assigned task. 

*STORY WHEN ISSUE CREATOR SETUP REMINDER*
* Bill is creating an Issue for John and the issue needs to be completed on current day, while creating the Issue, Bill added (reminder time 3:00 PM) to remind John to complete the task before day ends.
* At 3:00 PM John gets an email or desktop notification to complete the task, John sees the notification and completes the task 
 
*STORY WHEN ASSIGNEE OF THE ISSUE SETUP THE REMINDER*
* Bill is creating an Issue for John and the issue needs to be completed on current day, while creating issue Bill didn't add a reminder time for john to complete the task before day ends.
* As John receives email or desktop notification that an issue has been assigned to you, John him self adds a 3:00 PM time as a reminder on that issue to start work. 
* At 3:00 PM John gets an email or desktop notification to complete the task, John sees the notification and completes the task.

*WORKFLOW*
# In issue creation screen or popup there will be two more fields available one is to set reminder time and the other is to reminder date.
# Issue create will select date to set the reminder. (Date format and Timezone handling will be required)
# Issue creator will set reminder time (Time format and Timezone handling will be required).
# When the reminder day and time comes, issue assignee will get reminder email or desktop notification.
# Option to snooze desktop notification will be available.
# If the assignee is not taking action on issue even after the reminder, issue creator will be notified through email or desktop notification.
fields.summary: FEATURE: Set Time For Reminder in Issue

fields.description:
Roadmap view is useful to see the association of child-issues (stories, tasks) to Epics, and to see the association of Epics with time periods (calendar months, weeks, or days).

However, in KANBAN process, the main unit of time for planning purpose is the SPRINT.

Also, Epics may span multiple sprints, and the current Roadmap does not visually show to which sprint (or sprints) a child issue has been assigned.

As a user, in the Roadmap view, I want to be able to select SPRINTS (in addition to month, week or day) as unit of time, and then to be able to assign the child issues (stories and tasks) to those sprints within the roadmap view.

Ideally, I'd like the association of child issues to sprints to be shown on the roadmap view in the form on rectangles, like a GANTT chart (as is currently already displayed for the Epics)

Ideally, I'll like those child-issue rectangles to have a progress bar, with colors corresponding to issue statuses (in the same way that progress bars are already shown for Epics).  That way, I could see at a glance how and Epic is progressing and can visually see when a child issue that was supposed to be completed in a single sprint ended up needing to be assigned to multiple sprints.

These changes would make the Roadmap view correspond to the way I plan for projects:
 * First I figure out the Epics I need to pursue to accomplish the business objectives
 * Second I figure out the stories and task required to achieve the Epic
 * Third I figure out how Epics lay out over time, based on my customers' priorities and the logical sequence of development and dependencies
 * Fourth, I figure out how the stories and tasks can be assigned to sprints (at least for the next few sprints)
 * Then, after each sprint, I adjust the plan based on what I learned and what was actually completed during prior sprint.
fields.summary: In Roadmap, offer Sprints as columns and show Child-issue assigned to sprints like GANTT

fields.description:
h3. Summary

"Story Point Estimate" field in next-gen project cannot be set to zero.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create an issue in next-gen project

h3. Expected Results

Value zero will be entered.

h3. Actual Results

Nothing appears in the field.

There is no workaround.

fields.description:
In Classic projects, there is a "Browse Projects" permission. This makes it possible to give jira-users read access to one project, without allowing them to see all the other Jira projects.

This is not possible with Next-Gen. If a jira-user has any permission in a Next-Gen project, they can automatically see the full Jira project list. This is an issue if the jira-users include clients, for example, who have privacy concerns.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict who can "Browse Projects"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As per title, it is no longer possible to link a page to a sprint after the UI update. Previously, you can click on the 'linked pages' hyperlink to link Confluence pages to a sprint as shown in https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/linking-a-confluence-page-to-a-sprint-764478134.html/ . 

With the UI update, the 'linked pages' is changed to 'Plan Sprint' instead. Clicking on the plan sprint shows a drop down with a few options. Clicking on any of the options just redirects you to Confluence and does not link any pages.

!image-2020-04-02-15-55-42-606.png|thumbnail! 

This behavior also does not change after you add a Confluence space to 'Pages'.

 !image-2020-04-02-15-57-07-215.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Activate Confluence on your Cloud instance
# Navigate to a sprint and click on 'Plan Sprint' to link a Confluence page
 
h3. Expected Results

There should be a window or pop up that allows you to choose which page to link to a sprint.

h3. Actual Results

Redirection to Confluence without any indication on what to do next.

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

No workaround for this currently.
fields.summary: Not possible to link pages to sprint after UI update

fields.description:
When we use the quick issue creation available on Jira Software Classic boards, if there is a required field, we are redirected to the issue create screen.

It is expected since the quick issue creation does not support required fields, we can only enter the issue's summary from the quick issue creation screen.

However, when it happens, the issue create screen will not keep the selected issue type during the quick issue creation process, you will need to change the issue type value once more.

It would be great if the quick issue creation could somehow send the issue type information to the create issue screen, with this, the user would not need to select the issue type once more.
fields.summary: Jira Software classic boards - Quick issue creation should send the issue type information when redirecting to the issue creation screen.

fields.description:
We're currently using the Xray 3rd party tool to log tests against sprint stories. The tests are linked to the parent story.

When viewing these issues in the sprint board swimlanes, we would like a way to group these tests and sub-tasks together to get a full overview of what work is required to complete the story within the view.
fields.summary: Option to group by linked issues as part of the next gen sprint board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It would be wonderful if Jira Rest API could have an endpoint allowing you to import JSON files that are loaded in the JSON Import Function implemented in the User interface.

With this feature, we could save a lot of effort if we load these files and everything gets created instead of using the individual REST API to create custom fields, Issue Types, Issues, etc.

Being said that, we can focus efforts on creating and validating a single input: the JSON file, instead of validating every single endpoint. 
h3. Expected Results

Create rest API endpoint like: /rest/api/3/issues/import/json.... in order to import JSON files compatible with this KB [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-json-776636779.html]
h3. Actual Results

NA
h3. Workaround

Use the User Interface to import JSON files.
fields.summary: Create API Endpoint to load JSON files.

fields.description:
When we are clicking on a hyperlink - e.g. referenced Jira issue, any weblink - as the idea is to view the Jira issue and reference link IN TANDEM TO EACH OTHER. 

PLS, and thanks.
fields.summary: When clicking on a hyperlink, to open a NEW TAB, instead of opening that link in the existing window.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Software classic boards settings
If the Swimlanes are set to be based on Epics and there are Stories associated with Epics not returned by your board filter, those Stories won't show up on your Kanban Board / Scrum Active Sprints page.

Swimlanes based on Epic description:
Group issues under their epic. Issues not assigned to an epic will be shown in their own group at the bottom. Epics with no issues on the board will not be shown.

It is expected behavior, however, it can be annoying since Stories with Epics from a different project will vanish from your board.

h3. Workaround

Kanban board: Change the board filter to show all existing Epics in Jira plus your project issues.
For example: issuetype = Epic or project = TEST

Active Sprints: 
If the Epics and Stories are under different projects but using the same sprint, you can use the workaround above.
If the Epics and Stories are under different projects and under different sprints, there is no workaround, they won't show up on your active sprints tab at all since active sprints don't show issues that are not part of your sprint.
fields.summary: Jira Software classic boards settings - Swimlanes set by Epics displaying Epics not listed on the board filter.

fields.description: Add labels as an option in swimlanes (group by), just like there is for subtasks, epics, etc.
fields.summary: Add labels as an option in swimlanes (group by)

An edit that changes the case of a column names on a next-gen board isn't persisted.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Click on a column name ("Kick Off") to rename it
 # Enter a new name that differs by case ("Kick off"), and hit enter

h3. Expected Results

The new name has persisted.
h3. Actual Results

The previous case remains.
h3. Workaround

Go via a different name, with two separate edits.

Add a similar option to security levels as it can be done into Classics projects.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 02 Apr 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|titleColor=#FFFFFF|bgColor=#E7F4FA}

After some analysis we've found that this issue has been duplicated by the issue at [(JSWCLOUD-18806) Actions button doesn't show the list when the menu has a lot of options|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-18806]. This is a current and verified bug in Jira Software, please watch that issue for further updates and more detailed workarounds.

{panel}

h3. Issue Summary

Actions button in Backlog view doesn't open if it contains more options in new issue view. The more add-ons Cloud instance has, it would populate more options in *Actions* button in Backlog view and Jira can't open it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Installed a few add-ons which populate more options in _Actions_ button
 # Create some issues in a board
 # Open Backlog view

h3. Expected Results

The Actions button responds and shows all the options.
 * !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens
h3. Workaround
 * Disable new view from [https://URL.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa|https://url.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa]
 * Or, zoom out the browser until it displays all the options.
fields.summary: Actions button in Backlog view doesn't open if it contains more options

fields.description:
We have a lot of cases when people post some technical information and part of that information is being translated into emojis. Sometimes it actually completely breaks the meaning of that.

For example `something:Private` can be easily converted into `something:Private` and there are a lot of cases like that. 

We need an option to turn off this feature globally or at least per project.

We use Jira Cloud.
fields.summary: Turn off emoji for descriptions and comments

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Component or fixVersion does not get assigned to issues if the Component or fixVersion name is used in another Project:
 * when the Board filter references the Component or fixVersion

h3. Environment

Atlassian Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce

For Board filter:
 # Create a project A and create a Component (or fixVersion) with name "XXX"
 # Create a project B and create a Component (or fixVersion) with name "XXX"
 # Create a board whose Board filter references the Component (or fixVersion):
 ** {{ project = A and component = "XXX"}}

h3. Expected Results

Creating an issue on the board via Inline issue create should automatically assign it to the component "XXX".
h3. Actual Results

The Created Screen indicates an error even XXX component exists 

!image-2020-03-24-15-56-38-108.png|width=368,height=257!
h3. Workaround

Have Components and fixVersions using unique names.
fields.summary: Multiple components with the same name prevents auto-population of component when created from board

 !Screen Shot 2020-03-23 at 19.39.00.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if you have your burndown report to be based on Remaining Time Estimate and the issue have no Remaining Time Estimate value, any worklog done on the issue will not show as *Time Spent* on the burndown report. 

And since burndown report always refer to the history of the issue, this can't be configured.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to modify the burndown report whenever there is a mistake made like the example above.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the board is using a complex filter and Jira is not able to retrieve the projects that are on the board, having *Manage Sprints* permission for all projects will not be enough to *Create Sprint* on the board. The user will be able to *Start* any existing sprints and *Complete* any active sprints too.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a board using filter like *Assignee = A* or *component = A*
 #* [Using Manage Sprints permission for advanced cases|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/using-manage-sprints-permission-for-advanced-cases-800708249.html]
 # Grant a user *Manage Sprints* permission for every project in the instance
 # The user is not able to *Create Sprint* on the board, the button is greyed out:
 #*  !image-2020-03-19-15-32-44-978.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* The user should be able to *Create Sprint* as the user has *Manage Sprints* permission.

h3. Actual Results
* The user needs to be a Jira administrator in order to *Create Sprint* in a board that uses a complex filter.


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Create Sprint requires Jira Administrator permission if the filter of the board is complex

At the moment, we are able to right-click on a scrum board to "Move to Top of Backlog" or "Move to Top of Sprint X".

It would be great to have one that "Moved to top of Priority X" to easily move things around in the backlog.
fields.summary: Right click in Scrum Board - Move to Top of Priority 1/2/3

fields.summary: Availability to manage permissions on the Organizations you have access

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the development section of a Jira issue, you can view commits. When you click on the commits and look at the details of bitbucket commits the count of the number of files changed is not correct.

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud
* Bitbucket

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a commit with more than 5 file 
# Add the Jira issue key in the commit message

h3. Expected Results
Jira displays the actual number of file changes in the commit tab

h3. Actual Results
Jira displays on 5 files instead

h3.Workaround
No available workaround
fields.summary: Jira displays the wrong number of files changed in Bitbucket commits

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you see an issue in the old issue view the unassigned icon is broken.
It is working fine in the new issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to an unassigned issue in the old issue view
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The default icon (working fine in new issue view)
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
The icon is shown as a broken picture
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Use the new issue view.

fields.description:
In Automation for Jira, it's possible to create an automation rule that starts according to Sprint events (Sprint created, Sprint started, Sprint completed). However, it's only possible to select boards from Classic projects when configuring these triggers. Boards from Next-gen projects won't appear in the dropdown.

 !Screen Shot 2020-03-16 at 16.04.37.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to use automation triggers related to Sprints in Next-gen projects

fields.description:
As a team member

I want issue templates for Jira

So I can default content for new requests without the need to buy add-on tools for Jira

 

Acceptance criteria:
 * Issue templates can be defined at an instance or project level
 * Issue templates can be selected as defaulted for specific issue types at an instance or project level
 * Issue templates can set default values for any user entry fields
 * Issue template used by an issue is a searchable field
 * Issue template management allows create, view, update, and delete
 * Issue template management changes are logged, and visible users with issue template management permissions
 * Issue templates can be applied to issues generated via automation, such as email creation of issues and import
 * Issue templates are a built-in feature for cloud and server versions of Jira, requiring no additional marketplace add-ons
fields.summary: Add issue templates

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Issue Layout, if you have Epic Link under *Context Field* (above Hide when empty line), and when the *Epic Link* field is empty, this field is missing from the issue view entirely.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add *Epic Link* to the *Context Field* (above Hide when empty line) in *Issue Layout*.
 # Make sure the *Epic Link* field doesn't have a value.

h3. Expected Results
* The *Epic Link* field should appear on the issue view, whether it has a value or not.

h3. Actual Results
* The *Epic Link* field is missing.

h3. Workaround
* Add the *Epic Link* field below the *Hide when empty* line and the *Epic Link* field will appear.

h3. Notes
If the *Epic Link* field has a value before, and it got removed, it'll appear in the issue just fine.
fields.summary: Epic Link field is not appearing despite having it under Context field

fields.description:
Hi,

 
 * As we are using LDAP directories for our users we can not use nested group in our configuration

Please find below our context and need (easier to have all the informations in the ticket) :

 

So in our instance we have several usecases :
 * Scrum Team

 * SAFe programs
....

We have a portal to create users for JIra/Confluence and several tools of a Devops toolchain. In order to manage the user we centralize the user management by this portal. We set three roles in JIRA. These are associated with JIra Groups.

By exemple in the projet DVSTEST. The user are managed like this :

 

Rôle : project-administrator
Group : <nameOfProject>-admin

Rôle : project-user
Group : <nameOfProject>-user

Rôle : project-reader
Group : <nameOfProject>-reader

In our SAFe organizations we have lots of users, lots of groups and lots of projects that have to interact with each other

So my need would be to create a "super-group" for a SAFe organization and to have the possibility to add in this group Jira native Group (which are managed with our portal). 
It would be usefull to give to all the Jira project Group reading rights.

Ex : Super Group : SAFe_Marketing_reader
In the delegated group : Put all the projects group that would be like to have the reader rights.

Then add the SAFe_reader super group in all the SAFe projects.

That would be a benefit of complexity and of time for us.

I think I would not be the only one who would be interested by this feature (especially SAFe organizations)

Thanks in advance for your consideration.
Please feel free to ask me more question if it is not clear.

 

 

Thanks for your interest.

Regards,

 

Antoine
fields.summary: Ability to have nested group with LDAP directory

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if the board's swimlane is based on *Stories*. It's not possible to drag and drop the stories.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the option to drag and drop issue that are based on the swimlane.

h3. Workaround
* Navigate to the backlog to order the issues by drag and drop
* Right-click on the issues on the Kanban/Sprint to move it to the *Top* or *Bottom* of the swimlane.
fields.summary: Ability to order/rank issues that are based on the swimlane

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In next-gen projects, if the last column (the resolution column) is dragged to another position all its issues kept the resolution.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Put some issues in the last column
 # Dragg the column to a different position
 [^Resolution kept in next gen.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
The resolution in the issues is removed as the column is not the resolution column now

h3. Actual Results
The issues keep with the resolution so they disappear from the board after 14 days


h3. Workaround

The issues need to be changed to a different status and then transition them back this updates the resolution by removing it.
fields.summary: In next-gen the resolution is kept for the issues of the last column if it is dragged to another position

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The cumulative flow diagram has its default set of colors, which cannot be changed:
 !Screen Shot 2020-03-13 at 16.14.05.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion

Provide options to customise those colors.

Specially because some teams have color blind people, which can make it difficult to align everyone with the results in the report.
fields.summary: Ability to customise the colors of the Cumulative Flow diagram

fields.description:
While using the agile board, there are a few important ways to look at the data:

 - Are there any unassigned tasks?

 - Who is overloaded / underloaded

 

This ticket is for the last issue.  Sorting by user allows for easier load balancing in sprint planning meetings.  It could potentially also address the first issue as unassigned tasks would be grouped together and therefore easier to find.

 

This is the view I'm referring to. Not sure of the official name:
!image-2020-03-12-12-08-46-952.png!
fields.summary: Sort by user on agile board

fields.description:
A common part of sprint planning is deciding what to do with unassigned tasks.

Currently there is no way to find these in the sprint agile board except to visually look for the absence of people's faces.

This is tedious with a larger team and/or a large set of tasks.

 

You can click an individual to see their tasks, but un-clicking everyone shows all tasks rather than the unassigned tasks.

 

This is the board I'm referring to (not sure of the official name):

!image-2020-03-12-12-03-25-493.png|width=502,height=240!
fields.summary: Provide unassigned filter for agile board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users cannot complete a sprint from tickets moved from another project with an active sprint, the sprint stays linked to the original project board and that causes errors to end users on the new project, saying they don't have the *Manage sprints* permission, even though they have on both old and new projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a classic Jira Software project with a SCRUM board with an active sprint with some issues.
# Move these issues to another classic Jira Software project with a SCRUM board.
# Have the developers with *Manage sprints* permission complete the sprint.

h3. Expected Results
The users with *Manage sprints* permission on all related projects should be able to complete the sprint.

h3. Actual Results
The button is greyed out and the tooltip below shows up when hovering the mouse pointer on the button:
{noformat}
You need the Manage Sprints
permission to start or complete this sprint.
{noformat}

h3. Notes
The projects might even share the same permission scheme.

h3. Workaround
Move the issues to a new sprint on the new project and have an upper level administrator complete the sprint.
fields.summary: Users cannot complete a sprint from tickets moved from another project with an active sprint

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Bitbucket Jira integration matches Jira issue keys with Jira issues that did not exist before the commit/branch or pull request were created.

h3. Suggested Solution
Bitbucket Jira integration should ignore matching Jira issue keys with issues that did not exist before the commit/branch or pull request.

h3. Why this is important
 It can cause many errors, confusions and mistakes for users and cannot be unlinked from the Jira issue.

h3. Workaround 
(Optional)
fields.summary: Bitbucket commits links to Jira issues that do not exist before the creation of the commit

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Actions button doesn't show the list when the menu has a lot of options

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Actions button has a lot of options (e.g from installed add-ons)
 # From the backlog, select an issue
 # Click in Actions (...)
 # The options don't appear
 # Video: [https://share.getcloudapp.com/JruWnd29]

h3. Expected Results
When you click in "Actions", you should see all the options

h3. Actual Results
When you click in "Actions" from the backlog, the options don't appear

h3. Workaround
- Disable new view from https://URL.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa
- Zoom out the browser until it displays all the options
- [Expand/maximize the browser window|https://cl.ly/06e814705cba]
fields.summary: Actions button doesn't show the list when the menu has a lot of options

fields.description: Provide a trigger for workflow to allow Git - Pull Request Reviews to move a Jira issue into the next transition status.
fields.summary: Git Workflow Trigger - Pull Request Reviews

fields.description:
Based on the comments and feedback in the community portal and in the JSWCLOUD-17392 issue, there's a lot of frustration about people who have put their faith in Next Gen projects and have been consistently let down. Maybe if you had called it "Project Streamline" or "Jira Lite", you wouldn't be on the receiving end of all the animosity by your community.

As a first step, I'd highly recommend switching to Next Gen and start dogfooding the half-baked product your most devoted users have eagerly adopted. 

aside: In who's mind is a single issue with 211 subtasks a reasonable method of running a project.
fields.summary: Next Gen Team should use a Next Gen board

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the Build tab on the development panel is open, a message says "Mention ABC-123 in a branch name or commit message to start tracking builds here."

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect Jira and Bitbucket > Create a commit linked to a Jira issue
# Go to the Jira issue > Click on commit tab > Navigate to the Build Tab

h3. Expected Results
Mention ABC-123 in a branch name and commit message to start tracking builds here.

h3. Actual Results
Mention ABC-123 in a branch name or commit message to start tracking builds here.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
Bitbucket build only show on Jira when the Issue key is mentioned in the branch name, not in the commit message. The deployment shows when the issue key is mentioned in the commit message

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Builds not shown when issue key in commit messages

fields.description:
I would like it if Jira would provide a static HTML client for its services. The current client consumes too much resources for too little gain, is clunky and takes a while to render. In addition to that, clicking an issue link in the kanban board does not open it, but instead opens a sidebar that is very cramped. The WSYIWYG editor has its own format, instead of supporting a widely supported markdown. Modals over modals over modals create more headaches compared to a regular form filling out experience.

 

Frankly I miss old Jira client. Why did you have to change what is not broken?
fields.summary: Static HTML client
